page.title: 17Language ('Sosh')
page.content: 'Sosh' writes a small column weekly in local Cheadle Dialect in the Cheadle & Tean Times.'He' has allowed us to use this extract(+ Translation!).Well wayer feed up we this weather,but ar recken th'owd farmers er'avun moower fed up with it thun way fer these now end er 'ey lyin in faylds raynd er bayt int thee.Ar've owleys said arm glad ar niver add er job thut yer add ter rely on th' weather fer er livin,ar dunner remember er wos summer thun this dun yow.-Well we're fed up with this weather,but I reckon the old farmers are even more fed up with it than we are,for there's no end of hay lying in the fields round about,isn't there?. I've always said that I'm glad that I never had a job that you had to rely on the weather for a living. I don't remember a worse Summer than this do you?.
